result.execSummary:
The defendant Althea M Drummer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Court would allow good time and Huber privileges, if working.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.  Anger management.  Court ordered defendant to move from her current residence within 90 days of today's date (by 8/27/14).

No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for her mental or physical needs; take as prescribed and only for as long as medically and reasonably necessary.  No alcohol; urine screens.  No contact in any way, shape or form with Lisa C.
Obtain GED.  Seek and maintain employment.  Job and vocational training.

Court ordered defendant to pay the DNA surcharges for Counts 1 and 2, costs and disbursements.  Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant, which is non-dischargable in bankruptcy.

Court ordered defendant to pay restitution to be determined at a later date (Restitution hearing on 6-16-14 @ 8:30 a.m.).

**06-16-14/ Dennis P Moroney**
Court ordered  the defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $$15.50, payable to Lisa C.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

timeConds.notes: As to both counts: To be used at the discretion of the agent for any violations.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count 1. With good time allowed and Huber, if employed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Althea M Drummer

defendant.name: Drummer, Althea M
defendant.address: 3910 West Greenfield Ave, #12, West Milwaukee, WI 53215

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Amended JOC reflects 06-16-14 Court order for restitution.

Defendant Althea M Drummer in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Restitution hearing proceeds. Court ordered restitution be paid to the victim, Ms. Lisa C. in the amount of $15.50.  Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is non-dischargable in bankruptcy.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty of Counts 1 and 2 as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20 on 5/29/14 at 1:30 p.m. and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.

Defendant Althea M Drummer in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties advise the Court that they reached a resolution in this case.   Amended  Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

/submitted by the State, received and filed.  Defendant is charged as follows:

COUNT 01:
Battery, a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 940.19(1).

COUNT 02:
Disorderly Conduct,  a Class B Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 947.01(1).

Defendant Althea M Drummer in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request one more final pretrial date.  Court will leave negotiations open until the next final pretrial.  All terms and conditions of bail continue.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  File retained in court.

State's Requested Jury Instructions, received and filed with:
 - State's Witness List.

Defendant Althea M Drummer in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to adjourn the jury trial was granted by the Court, as the State had no objection. Court set a briefing schedule for any new evidence coming in that may warrant a motion hearing:  movant's motion due by 3/31/14; response due by 4/10/14; reply due by 4/15/14.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20 and that all conditions of bail continue.  The 4/02/14 jury trial date is vacated.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
/to Adjourn Jury Trial, received and filed. rn

Defendant Althea M Drummer in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requested a trial date.  Court set the following briefing schedule: defense motions due by 2/28/14; State's response due by 3/10/14; defense reply due by 3/17/14.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are due within one week of the final pretrial date.  All terms and conditions of bail continue.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Althea M Drummer in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Jay Pucek for DeAnn L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lisa C.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Althea M Drummer in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 01/21/2014 @ 1:30PM
